segment.documentation: BGM, A segment to indicate the beginning of a message and to transmit identifying number, and a further specification of the message type (in data element 1001: Document name code), such as Customs documents expiration notice, Customs clearance ready notice and message function.
DTM, A segment to indicate a date and/or time applying to the whole message, such as date and time of document or message issue.
FTX, A segment to specify free form or processable supplementary information, such as: - change information

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 1: A group of segments to specify a reference relating to the whole message, and its date and/or time.

segment.documentation: RFF, A segment to express a reference which applies to the entire message, such as: - reference to previous message - container announcement reference (being the acceptance order reference number) - carrier's agent reference number
DTM, A segment to indicate date and/or time related to the reference.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 2: A group of segments to indicate details of the movement of containers.

segment.documentation: TDT, A segment to indicate information related to the main carriage stage of the transport (sea), such as carrier/liner service.
DTM, A segment to indicate a date and time related to the transport details such as arrival date and time.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 3: A group of segments to specify a port related to the transport stage.

segment.documentation: LOC, A segment to indicate a port corresponding to the transport stage, such as port of loading or discharge.
DTM, A segment to specify date(s) and time(s) related to a location.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 4: A group of segments to identify a party and related contacts.

segment.documentation: NAD, A segment to identify the party's name, address, and function, such as: - message recipient - message sender - ordering customer - ordering customer agent - carrier agent (sea)

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 5: A group of segments to identify a contact and its communications related to the party.

segment.documentation: CTA, A segment to identify a person or department for the party, such as: - information contact
COM, A segment to identify a communication number of a person or department to whom communication should be directed.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 6: A group of segments to describe the goods items stuffed in containers.

segment.documentation: GID, A segment to identify a goods item stuffed in containers. A goods item can be identified by a goods item number.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 7: A group of segments to specify documents and associated date(s) and time(s) for a goods item.

segment.documentation: DOC, A segment to specify a document prepared for a goods item.
DTM, A segment to associate issue and expiry date with the prepared document.
SGP, A segment to identify the containers in which goods are transported.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 8: A segment group to identify dangerous goods.

segment.documentation: DGS, A segment to specify dangerous goods.
FTX, A segment to specify supplementary details regarding the dangerous goods such as the technical name of the dangerous goods etc.
MEA, A segment to specify measurements of the dangerous goods, such as: - net net weight.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 9: A segment group to specify contact information including communication details regarding the dangerous goods.

segment.documentation: CTA, A segment to identify a person or department to be contacted regarding the dangerous goods.
COM, A segment to specify communication details of the contact specified in the CTA segment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 10: A segment group to identify transport related temperature settings.

segment.documentation: TMP, A segment to specify the type of transport related temperature such as storage, transport or operating temperature and also to optionally specify a single value temperature setting.
RNG, A segment to optionally specify the transport related temperature as a range of values.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 11: A group of segments to specify containers in which goods are transported.

segment.documentation: EQD, A segment to specify container prefix and number.
RFF, A segment to specify the identifying number associated with a container, such as: - container sequence number
NAD, A segment to specify a pick-up address of Customs documents.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 12: A segment group to identify dangerous goods.

segment.documentation: DGS, A segment to specify dangerous goods.
FTX, A segment to specify supplementary details regarding the dangerous goods such as the technical name of the dangerous goods etc.
MEA, A segment to specify measurements of the dangerous goods, such as: - net net weight.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 13: A segment group to specify contact information including communication details regarding the dangerous goods.

segment.documentation: CTA, A segment to identify a person or department to be contacted regarding the dangerous goods.
COM, A segment to specify communication details of the contact specified in the CTA segment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 14: A segment group to identify transport related temperature settings.

segment.documentation: TMP, A segment to specify the type of transport related temperature such as storage, transport or operating temperature and also to optionally specify a single value temperature setting.
RNG, A segment to optionally specify the transport related temperature as a range of values.
CNT, A segment to specify the number of containers in the message, explicitly given by the sender.
